fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • A story said that if Gus O'Donnell were to serve as cabinet secretary for seven years, he would be the longest holder of his office. In recent times Robin Butler and Robert Armstrong have actually trumped that (O'Donnell not quitting, says Cabinet Office, 11 August, page 5). • A leader on philanthropy (Just giving, 7 August, page 28) referred to Robert Reich as a former US treasury secretary. Robert Reich was secretary of labour during Bill Clinton's first term of office, from 1993 to 1997. It was Robert Rubin who held the treasury post from 1995 to 1999. • An Edinburgh comedy review – Ronna and Beverly, 11 August, page 30 – should have named Jessica Chaffin as playing Ronna and Jamie Denbo as Beverly. • A feature referred to a giant Burmese mountain dog. That should have been Bernese (Face to face with my worst enemy, 9 August, page 10, G2). • A leader – In praise of… Thomas Cook timetables, 9 August, page 26 – said: "There is a steam train in the Hartz mountains in east Germany that will puff you up to the site of a former Soviet watchtower." That should have been Harz, and the installation was used in the cold war mainly for monitoring western broadcast signals.
